The Copyright Wall-Of-Shame === Reminder for all that 9 out of 10 times, the people who make a shitstorm about morality and ethics are the same people who don't abide by them and actually do worse things. This number increases to 10/10 with anti-pirate collectives as they have been observed and proven in these past few years of: 01. UMG/Deutsche Grammophon insisting on the [validity of their Youtube takedown claim relating to {Sinfonie Nr. 8 von F. Schubert und Sinfonie Nr. 5 von L.v. Beethoven, even though the protection date is explicitly stated as 1961 on the record itself](http://cc0.oer-musik.de/Home/EnAbout), with YouTube being not available to either solve or review the contested claim by Deutsche Grammophon/UMG. 01. Three anti-piracy lawyers who were employed by the anti-piracy group Antipiratgruppen, [being caught swindling almost $16 million dollars from the MPAA and other Rights holders](https://torrentfreak.com/anti-piracy-lawyers-sentenced-to-years-in-prison-for-defrauding-copyright-holders-180612/), in which the trio was ordered to serve prison sentencing for two to five years but are free to practice law upon release. 01. Sweden ISP Bahnhof calling into question [the validity of Sweedish judges who have ruled favorable on copyright cases](https://torrentfreak.com/isp-questions-impartiality-of-judges-in-copyright-troll-cases-180602/) while possessing a conflict of interests by maintaining their corporate relations. 01. Adobe [failing to pay licensing fees on the sales of Adobe products that contained Dolby technology](https://torrentfreak.com/dolby-labs-sues-adobe-for-copyright-infringement-180314/) by refusing to provide the agreed upon sales audits for multiple years over]. Demonstrating that the largest and most wealthiest of copyright enthusiasts will also happily ignore copyright conditions when it suits their own agenda. 01. Copyright enthusiast David Lowery casting criticism at professor Michael Geist over the importance of copyright acknowledgement all [while failing to obtain the proper license on an image shared in the Blog post](https://torrentfreak.com/when-a-pro-copyright-rant-goes-wrong-180225/). 01. FlightSimLabs [planting SecurityXploded.Com's ChromePasswordDump v5.5 to successfully capture the stored Google Chrome passwords](https://torrentfreak.com/flight-sim-company-embeds-malware-to-steal-pirates-passwords-180219/) of users who are allegedly using product keys that are found on file-sharing sites. 01. The company behind the 2015 drama film Fathers & Daughters [having their copyright infringement case being dismissed](https://torrentfreak.com/judge-tells-movie-company-that-it-cant-sue-alleged-bittorrent-pirate-180118/) due to the company's exclusive rights to the movie being sold to a company called Vertical Entertainment who were not part of the lawsuit. [{orig}](https://fightcopyrighttrolls.com/2018/01/17/federal-judge-fathers-and-daughters-nevada-llc-has-no-standing-to-sue-for-bittorent-copyright-infringement/) 01. Youtube allowing [multiple RIAA members to claim & monetize an uploaded video that contained nothing but white static noise.](https://torrentfreak.com/musicians-white-noise-youtube-video-hit-with-copyright-complaints-180105/) Illustrating that copyright is fundamentally broken and is only suitable to benefit a very select privileged few. 01. Music copyright advocates using the DMCA and domain seizures to cause irreparable harm to mash up sites like [Sowndhaus](https://torrentfreak.com/could-a-single-copyright-complaint-kill-your-domain-171203/) & [Spinrilla](https://torrentfreak.com/riaa-labels-sue-hip-hop-mixtape-download-site-spinrilla-170206/) by taking action of litigation without ever notifying the website owners of the [claim of infringement](https://torrentfreak.com/piracy-riaa-labels-asked-us-to-promote-their-music-spinrilla-says-170316/). 01. Epic Games' [taking aggressive judicial action against a 14 year old "Fortnite" cheater](https://torrentfreak.com/mom-defends-14-year-old-fortnite-cheater-in-court-171125/) over the usage of an online game cheat and multiple free accounts registered with fake email addresses. Demonstrating that copyright litigation is often the action of choice with little consideration of who may be targeted. 01. ABC, AOL, CBS Broadcasting, NBCUniversal, NPR, Time, Viacom, Warner Bros, Yahoo and Ziff Davi [settling with numerous photographers due to infringing use of their photographs](https://torrentfreak.com/pirating-mainstream-media-outlets-haunted-by-photographers-in-court-171028/) found throughout their News & Blog articles. In which CBS later [counter sue due to a Gunsmoke screen shot being posted on social media](https://torrentfreak.com/cbs-sues-man-for-posting-image-of-a-59-year-tv-show-on-social-media-171030/) in an attempt to reduce their damage settlement. Demonstrating that not even those who actively litigate copyright law don't bare any respect for it. 01. New Zealand's ruling National Party being [forced to pay $600k for infringing the copyrights of Eminem's track "Lose Yourself" due to using a derivative song with a similar melody for their campaign ad](https://torrentfreak.com/lose-yourself-national-party-guilty-of-eminem-copyright-infringement-171025/) demonstrating that even when obtaining proper licenses will not prevent a copyright related lawsuit. 01. Four officials of the Russian site-blocking body [Rozcomnadzor, {including spokesman, top lawyer, and Anastasiya Zvyagintseva} being charged with fraud](https://torrentfreak.com/russian-site-blocking-chiefs-under-investigation-for-fraud-171024/) and stand accused of having 'employed' ghost staff whose salaries were actually paid to existing employees, on top of their own money all while being allowed to block 4,000 sites on copyright grounds with an additional 41,000 innocent websites blocked as collateral damage demonstrating that copyright law often leaves a trail of harm rather than any potential good. 01. Game developer [Atlus targeting the Patreon page of the RPCS3 {Playstation 3} emulator with a DMCA takedown notice](https://torrentfreak.com/of-course-atlus-hit-rpcs3s-patreon-page-over-persona-5-170927/) due to a comment which stated that Atlus' game title Persona 5 will be compatible with the RPCS3 emulator, which resulted in an intimidation tactic that persuaded the RPCS3 development team to remove all occurrences of the compatibility reference from their Patreon and other pages while Atlus admits that the RPCS3 team has done nothing wrong nor infringed on any of their rights. Illustrating that abusive claims of copyright infringement are often made without hesitance. 01. Sega attempting to trick Steam users [by sneaking Denuvo into their Sonic Mania release by not specifying the third party DRM EULA on the store front page](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sonic-mania-pcs-drm-angers-players-sega-adds-offli/1100-6452993/) while the game was on pre-order and also handing out [a 'free' emulated Sonic the Hedgehog Sega Genesis/Mega Drive game](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/four-days-before-release-sonic-mania-pc-delayed-bu/1100-6452474/) to hinder the [issuance of refunds](http://store.steampowered.com/steam_refunds). 01. Media giant [ABS-CBN using the judiciary favor of a Florida Federal court to establish a $1.8 million dollar settlement from the operator of KissAsian,ch who is likely not a US citizen.](https://torrentfreak.com/florida-court-orders-pirate-site-kissasian-to-pay-1-8m-in-damages-170825/) Allowing much needed US resources to be devoted to foreign parties regarding their foreign affairs. 01. The [RIAA refusing to give accreditation to their musical artists and piece composers](https://torrentfreak.com/riaa-says-artists-dont-need-moral-rights-artists-disagree-170521/) with the refusal reason of ['it would be "complex" to always attribute writers for their work".](https://torrentfreak.com/artists-protest-riaa-for-trampling-on-their-moral-rights-170817/) 01. Flava Works [attempting to extort huge sums of cash {$97,000 – $525,000} from WE,tv's President & General Manager Marc Juris with threats of exposing his sexual preference to the public](https://torrentfreak.com/public-figure-threatened-with-exposure-over-gay-piracy-fine-170817/) in the event of failure to pay. Which, once again, illustrating that copyright enforcers are often worse than the most hardened of criminals. 01. The Anti-Ad-Blocking company [Admiral submitting a DMCA removal notice to the EasyList {ad-blocker definition} Github repository with the goal of having the Ad Server URl entry 'functionalclam.com^$third-party' removed from the list.](https://torrentfreak.com/dmca-used-to-remove-ad-server-url-from-easylist-ad-blocklist-170811/) Creating a slippery slope for future removals. 01. Copyright extortionists manipulation of the courts, led by Kerry Culpeppe and using intimidation tactics to accuse a [72 year old man](https://torrentfreak.com/72-year-old-man-accused-of-pirating-over-a-thousand-torrents-170810/), a [Texan woman](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-troll-claims-texan-woman-downloaded-over-54000-torrents-170713/), and [others](https://torrentfreak.com/86-year-old-grandma-accused-of-pirating-a-zombie-game-161031/) of mass infringement. 01. Telecom giant's Dish Network, Bell Canada, TVA, Videotron, and Rogers abuse of the judicial system with the goals of [shutting down TVAddons and intimidating Canadian resident Adam Lackman by allowing private agencies to seize control of the platform and equipment](https://torrentfreak.com/tvaddons-returns-ugly-war-canadian-telcos-kodi-addons-170801/) without any chance of legal representation or any real sense of justice or due process for the site operator. {Those who wish to show support can do so [[here](https://www.generosity.com/community-fundraising/tvaddons-legal-defense-fund)]} 01. The [RIAA making attempts to bring litigation against Cloudflare concerning numerous MP3Skull domains in an attempt to illustrate to the courts that Cloudflare is facilitating the activities of controversial sites](https://torrentfreak.com/cloudflare-asks-court-to-vacate-moot-pirate-site-blocking-order-170724/), regardless that the domains were owned by Sony Music Entertainment, who is an RIAA member. 01. [The Daily Mail willfully infringing copyrights and using unlicensed viral YouTube videos to promote their articles](https://torrentfreak.com/daily-mail-sued-for-pirating-dozens-of-viral-videos-170711/). Highlighting that companies will ignore the copyrights of others when there is a financial return. 01. The US State Department, MPAA, and RIAA [asking Stanford University students to propagate a fake Twitter feud in an attempt to facilitate these agencies anti-piracy goals](https://torrentfreak.com/state-dept-mpaa-riaa-fake-twitter-feud-plan-backfires-170706/#disqus_thread) and using Benjamin Franklin, who conversely was an advocate of sharing, as their reference. 01. [The Premier League carelessly making attempts to remove Facebook.com from Google search](https://torrentfreak.com/premier-league-asks-google-to-take-down-facebooks-homepage-170429/) on the accusations of facilitating the infringement of their intellectual property, which should give grave concern over the recent [Notice-&-Staydown](https://torrentfreak.com/takedown-staydown-would-be-a-disaster-internet-archive-warns-160607/) proposals. 01. The [AEPI being caught swindling over 42.5 million euros from artists while top executives payed themselves over nearly five million euros between them](https://torrentfreak.com/huge-scandal-engulfs-greek-anti-piracy-royalties-group-170318/). After receiving a fine of 35 million euros, 7.5 million euros is left uncounted and leaving the orchestrator's of such schemes unaccountable. 01. The BPI having to [dismiss PIPCU's Management Board member David Wood {who played a key role in Operation Creative} on the grounds of gross misappropriation of funds and referring him to the Metropolitan Police only to file for bankruptcy after years of excessive financial influence](https://torrentfreak.com/police-investigate-former-bpi-anti-piracy-chief-pipcu-board-member-170317/), which further illustrating that those with positions of power typically commit the most severe crimes. 01. USTR Special 301 Report singling out countries, regardless of the country's numerous intellectual property enforcement measures. Leaving[Canada](https://torrentfreak.com/canada-rejects-flawed-and-one-sided-piracy-claims-from-us-govt-170310/) and [China](https://torrentfreak.com/china-seriously-doubts-objectivity-of-us-pirate-site-list-180120/) little choice but to disregard the list, describing it as "little more than a lobbying document and the content largely reflects biased submissions from lobby groups." 01. PIPCU facilitating the arrest of Callum Haywood & the seizure of his censorship circumvention proxies [only to have his charges dismissed two years later due to conflicting arguments by the prosecution.](https://torrentfreak.com/uk-court-dismisses-case-against-torrent-site-proxy-operator-170307/) {Illustrating that PIPCU and other law enforcement agencies are willing to cause real harm while operating on the sole interests of their donors regardless of any technological legality or relevant innocence.} 01. Google having to [submit a formal report to the U.S. Copyright Office which explained that 99.95% of the DMCA notices Google received in one month were bogus and didn't reference any valid links](https://torrentfreak.com/google-99-95-of-recent-trusted-dmca-notices-were-bogus-170222/). Which illustrates rightsholders lack of respect for the DMCA take-down systems that copyright advocates constantly label ineffective, while [demonstrating that any tool granted will be ineffective](https://torrentfreak.com/music-industry-wants-piracy-filters-no-takedown-whack-a-mole-170222/) due to the incompetence of the user. 01. A Seattle District Court judge [Ricardo Martinez, having to introduce a newly conceived method of handing the default judgments demands of copyright advocates](https://torrentfreak.com/judge-splits-750-piracy-penalty-between-bittorrent-peers-170217/) by splitting the minimal allowed sum between all accused parties which resulting in a fine of a few hundred instead of the thousands that rightsholder demand as their compensation for loss. 01. The creators of Denuvo, [carelessly securing their website resulting in an intelligence leak](https://torrentfreak.com/crackers-swarm-as-denuvo-website-leaks-secret-information-170205/) while advocating how secure their anti-tamper technology is. 01. French tax authorities accusing VideoLAN of having financial ties to a torrent website named Torrent9, [on the basis that the torrent site's help section offering a link and recommendations to VideoLAN's VLC Media Player](https://torrentfreak.com/tax-authority-grills-vlc-player-over-link-from-a-torrent-site-170130/). While the accusation was later retracted due to public protest, the act highlights the misconceived ideology of those who have enforcement powers. 01. Casey Tebo [attempting a publicity stunt](https://torrentfreak.com/after-pirate-shoplifting-stunt-movie-director-speaks-out-170122/) by pretending to steal clam chowder ingredients from a supermarket [ in an attempt to prove a point relating to copyright infringement](https://torrentfreak.com/movie-director-steals-clam-chowder-to-avenge-illegal-downloads-170119/) in an effort to spread awareness of his film. 01. Finding two principals of Prenda Law guilty of the charges of conspiracy to commit fraud, money laundering, and perjury by a Minnesota District Court of law, demonstrating acknowledgement by the U.S. Government who accuses Prenda principals [John Steele and Paul Hansmeier](https://torrentfreak.com/prenda-copyright-trolls-arrested-and-charged-with-fraud-and-extortion-161216/) of running a multimillion-dollar fraud and extortion operation which eventually [led to their disbarrment in an Illinois Supreme Court](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-troll-attorney-john-steele-disbarred-by-illinois-supreme-court-170522/) 01. Having to force an [Oregan Judge to deny Voltage Pictures legal expense demands of $17,348l](https://torrentfreak.com/court-protects-bittorrent-pirate-from-overaggressive-filmmakers-161214/) due to an original agreed settlement amount of $750 plus reasonable attorney fees. Showing that a copyright advocate believes an entire bill sum is a 'reasonable' amount only later to be forced to [pay a similar amount](https://torrentfreak.com/court-protects-bittorrent-pirate-from-overaggressive-filmmakers-161214/) to the defendants. 01. The Hamburg Regional Court [expecting anyone who shares a link must have preemptive knowledge if the linked material is infringing or not](https://torrentfreak.com/unknowingly-linking-to-infringing-content-is-still-infringement-court-rules-161210/) and are required to properly attribute it's license, if any exist. Expressing that a lack of knowledge of infringement does not equal innocence. 01.
